Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT PURCHASE!!!
Reviews.Author: zuma
Reviews.Content: First off, this review is based on the TV, price paid, and features it has, i.e. "value for the money". That said, this is a great TV with a good picture (but I have not done a side-by-side comparison with other HDTVs). Games play fine, not sure why others had problems...maybe they did not do the set-up correctly. TV does have a "Game" mode which is supposed to help any lag one might experience, and under advanced picture mode, you can set the "Smooth Motion Effect" to various levels. One of the main reasons I purchased this TV was that Vizio is one of the few manufacturers that list the power usage of their TVs without having to do a lot of searching, which was important to me. I have owned this TV for about a week.I noticed some reviews say this TV has poor side views.  I do not see that at all, in fact i have never owned a LCD TV that has NO decrease in picture quality when viewed from the side until this one.  The TV is advertized with a 178 degree viewing angle and i would say that is true...this TV has a GREAT side viewing ablity.Side note: Too bad one of the first reviews gave this TV a bad rating based on perceived lag which is not true. But first reviews always get the most votes because they are automatically put at the top, which is a catch twenty-two, because that tends to keep them at the top (people vote most for the first few reviews they see, thereby keeping them on top).PROS:PriceGreat valueEasy setupLight weight (this thing only weighs 67 pounds, but TV is about 5" thick)Picture quality...very nice picture (but did not check out 1080P)Energy Star 4...uses only 138 watts (THIS IS A BIG ONE, will save you a lot of money!) Edit 12/19/2010-see below.CONS (minimal):Sound is not the best, but still pretty goodNo direct hookup to online media (i.e. Netflix, etc.) (but of course I knew this, I just use my DVD player)Style is good, not great (but still much BETTER than the original Vizios)Minimal connections, 3 HDMI, and only 1 composite & AV, really s/b two eachNo side connections-(except for 1 HDMI & USB) worst con in my opinionPoor onboard TV controls (without remote) ...but I guess this is normal nowadaysAnd this is not part of the overall rating, but the Amazon TV information (specs), purchase, checkout, truck delivery time (to inside house) and setup was top-notch, I knew when the TV would be delivered (2 hour time frame) at time of purchase! No problems!! I would definitely buy this TV again.Edit: 12/19/2010I tried the video games Quake 4, Serious Sam and Super Mario World, still cannot perceive a lag. I am no game expert, but I have not found any problem.Also hooked up a "Kill A Watt" to check power usage, watts used when off = 0...Good! Watts used when on and using zoom (full screen) ranged from 160 to 200 with the average in between (mostly 170 to 180)...Not so Good! This is higher than I hoped but still good for such a large TV. But I wonder how they got the advertised 138 watts?Edit: 1/23/2011Per the site: [...] this TV is rated at 152 watts. The maximum wattage an energy star 4.1 TV of this size can use to qualify is 178 watts.

Reviews.Title: Turn of Smooth Motion!
Reviews.Author: Rod
Reviews.Content: This is a good, low priced TV, no frills but a good basic big TV.  The problems the other reviews talk about, with video lag and processing that takes away the film-look bothered me right away as well, and give the images a very weird effect.  I thought maybe it was just me, or I wasn't used to a good quality picture, but whatever it was was not good.  I really noticed it with fast motion sports, a football in the air was jittery and choppy.  But there is a solution - on the second page of the TV Picture setting (select "more" at the bottom of the first Picture screen) there is a setting called Smooth Motion.  Turn it off, and turn the Smooth Motion DEMO off.  Problem solved, no more lag, jitters, and the film grain is back in the image.

Reviews.Title: Everyone loves our TV, including me
Reviews.Author: David Spicher
Reviews.Content: We purchased this from a different retailer for 1399 around Jan 2010. It looks amazing in hi def with broadcasts like Glee, Marriage Ref, or regular DVDs.Counter to the other reviews, The playstation looks awesome too, Full 1080P. I haven't noticed unplayable issues of lag, & I game online all the time. There was lag when I went through my receiver first via HDMI enough to notice in guitar hero or rock band, so I plug in directly ps3 to TV now for video because of that. I can't help but wonder if that kid knew how to hook up his game console. Hint: if it isn't with an HDMI cable, then you aren't seeing HiDef 1080 correctly. We've had nothing but jaw dropping fan reviews from our picture, people always want to come back and play/watch some more.Vizios also have ability to turn off speakers and have more adjustments to audio, this is good, as I rarely use the TVs speakers. Had a friend tell me his new Sony wouldn't let him do that.Cons: this TV can see through green screens... making fake shots look even more fake. I've tried to adjust it myself, but came back to default settings which looked better than mine. It brightens movies, losing that film effect, making movies look more like soap operas or camcorder shots. I suspect 'backlight' to be the cause of this, but again, I was never happy with my adjustments to make it better. another thing, when the screen is really bright, and I can see a fault in the 'plastic film' near part of the screen, a fold. I'd have to point it out to you it's so minor and you wouldn't see it 99 percent of the time, but it was a fault in my particular tv.My panasonic Viera picture is slightly better & less bright, but I would make this purchase again over & over.(especially at the new price!)

Reviews.Title: Great, No Frills Big TV
Reviews.Author: J. Jordan
Reviews.Content: I wasn't TV shopping when Amazon last had this TV on Cyber Monday for $899.  When I started shopping, it was up to $988, which was still good, but I didn't pull the trigger. I ended up buying locally at CompUSA/Tiger Direct during a 2-day sale for $899.  So even with tax, I was happy to be able to bring it home immediately and avoid the possibility of delivery issues other reviewers have mentioned.About the picture: Right out the box, with the factory settings, the picture is crisp and very nice!  Looked better than it did in the store!  Set up was VERY easy.  Take it out, set up to the cable box, pull off plastic, turn it on, watch TV.  Took just a few minutes.  Now that I've had it a few days, I've experimented with all the settings other have mentioned.  There are enough picture options for standard viewing, movies, different sports, and games that everyone will find something useful.  Picture will be a matter of taste, so use other reviewer's suggestions to narrow down on settings to your liking. I still have to swap out my current cable box for HDTV programming, so I can only imagine how good it will look if regular programming looks this good!As far as limited inputs, that is true, but all I needed was a good looking big flat panel TV.  I plan only to add a blu ray and Wii, so this TV more than fits my needs.  I compared plasma, LCD, LED, and looked at TVs with internet applications.  If you plan to add a lot of equipment and want all those internet applications, you may need to go with something with more HDMI input. I decided against plasma because I found dwindling availability. It seems LCD/LED is the way to go.  I went LCD over LED for cost, and I prefer the less glossy picture that it offers over plasma.  This TV replaced a big (but nice) 200lb HDTV rear projection, which costs me $2000 6 years ago and is worth just pennies today.  At that time, plasma and DLP started at $4000.  Very few DLP being sold, and similarly sized plasma can now be had for $700, so I'm glad I didn't spend $4000 back then!  I didn't break the bank to go LCD, and saved quite a bit over a similarly sized LED.It's big, it's nice looking, it has a crisp picture, and it's not a heavy monster. This TV will fit most people's needs.  But whatever you decide, don't overbuy.  Don't spend hundreds for features you will not use. Prices continue to come down as technology evolves.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice TV
Reviews.Author: tahadda
Reviews.Content: Please dont let any negative reviews bother you on this tv. I was shaky at first too, but if you look long enough everything has a bad review. If you want a great tv, without all the extras you dont need, then get this, you wont be dissapointed. I have an xbox, bluray, and directtv hooked into my surround sound reciever with hdmi's and everything looks and sounds awesome. All the lagging issues for gaming are probably bad installation or using componet cables instead of hdmi's, i  got a 6' cable for 2.99 by the way on amazon as well,,, again you wont be dissapointed

Reviews.Title: Great tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Gamer
Reviews.Content: Great TV! There are some better tvs out there but you would have to spend hundreds more. Plus, its not like you will ever have 2 large Tvs side by side. My buddy brought over his high dollar sony bravia (for system link gaming party), and you could tell maybe a slight difference in picture side by side. But not enough of a difference to justify the hundreds extra he spent! I also do a lot a gaming and I havent noticed any lagging issues, I play plenty of high speed games such as Modern 2, Black Ops, Dantes Inferno ect with no problems. Good bright clear picture and quick response. I have read some others complaints about some lagging issue but I hardly beleive its the television, maybe more user error. I love my television, and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and great price
Reviews.Author: Pamela
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV from Amazon several weeks ago and just love it. It is our first HDTV and first flat screen so maybw I'm happy because it's so much better than what we had before. We have not played any video games on it yet but we have played DVD's through a Playstation 3 and through a regular DVD player.This screen is huge and the picture is very nice. We mounted it above our fireplace on a tilt and swivel mount so we are able to turn the TV in any direction but I have found that you can view this TV very well at many angles anyway.We paid $899 for it on Amazon and it included free shipping which was wonderful. The delivery men set it up and made sure it worked before they left.Since we bought this, we have also purchased a smaller Vizio from Walmart on Black Friday and we love it too.

Reviews.Title: Great except for one issue
Reviews.Author: Evan Eberhardt
Reviews.Content: I knew the picture on this set would be awesome.  And it is.  I have a 42" Vizio that is a couple years older that looks very similar in construction and it has had an outstanding picture.  The HD picture of this TV is excellent and easily equals any other brand.  Plus, the color reproduction bests other brands (such as LG and Sony), or at least to me it does.  Vizios are no joke picture wise, so do not be fooled by the price.  They routinely rank among the best by Consumer Reports and CNET for picture.  The SD picture is also very good and as good if not better than most other brands.Where Vizio falls behind is with the design of the set as the aesthetics are not exactly art worthy (and this set is nearly 5" thick, whereas current LED sets are getting ridiculously thin). If looks are not a big deal for you though, Vizio is hard to beat for the price (in fact, they can't be beat from my experience).  This set also has no online apps of any kind, so keep that in mind.  I have a Home Theater PC and an Xbox 360 so I do all my online and Netflix stuff that route.  Also, there are only 3 HDMI inputs, so be aware of how many you may need (unless you plug all your stuff into a receiver and then just feed one plug to the Vizio like I do).The 120hz seems to work okay, but I do not like it (never have on any set) and leave it off for all viewing (I like some blur because it seems natural).  The sound is also probably the best you will find on a flat panel TV (probably because the set is somewhat thick, Vizio can put decent speakers in).  The sound is by no means like a real 5.1 setup (my Klipsch HDT 500 speaker set driven by an Onkyo TX-SR508 is vastly superior of course), but for news and sitcoms it is plenty adequate.  Vizio claims an average wattage of ~150 watts for this set.  I have no way of checking this, but if this is true then that is another plus and it actually keeps it in the same power range as some newer LED sets.The only issue I have had is with some mura effect or 'clouding' in the bottom left corner of the picture.  If I use the dynamic contrast setting, it is minimized but still apparent during dark scenes.  This bothered me, so I called Vizio and it sounded like they were going to swap the set out after the first call.  Nice!  However, after emailing pictures two separate times to Vizio tech support, they decided the issue was 'normal' (to quote them exactly).  I am not entirely sure of this though.  Many LCDs will have some clouding, but usually it is so faint that unless you are really looking for it, you won't notice it.  In this case however, it is fairly easy to see during a dark scene.  So, I am a little peeved at Vizio for at first displaying awesome service, but then deciding to not help me out.  I was really tempted to return the set but it was actually fulfilled through TigerDirect and they do not cover return shipping (it looks like amazon does apparently...doh!) and for this big TV and bigger box it would have cost over 200 bucks to ship back (it has to go back via a big truck and prices ranged from $209-380!).  Add that to the $50 shipping I paid on the way out and I would be out a quarter of the TV's cost.  So, I have decided I will just live with the issue and NEVER buy a big TV online again unless they have an awesome return policy like amazon does (a retail store like Costco is ideal here where you can return a TV to any of their stores for any reason, no return shipping headaches to deal with).  The good news is that the clouding has gotten a little better since the first day.  Perhaps it will continue to improve (fingers crossed).  So, after this experience I still recommend Vizio but I would advice purchasing through a retailer where returns will not be an issue.UPDATE:Well, I lucked out.  I found a little cluster of 6 pixels stuck in the red color right in the middle of the screen and much to my surprise I learned that Vizio (on certain models, this one included) has a zero bright pixel defect guarantee.  So, Vizio's customer service setup a TV swap and in a couple weeks the freight company arrived (Manna, they were okay) and unboxed a new set and took the other one away (well, the replacement set is a refurb actually, and has a a couple small dings in the frame, but who cares, its the screen I am looking at).  This set does not have any mura effect or clouding that I can see (or stuck pixels), just the same awesome picture minus the backlight issue. So, I am a happy camper once again.  Nice job Vizio.  You may have retained me as a long term customer.

Reviews.Title: Bought for my Husband
Reviews.Author: Donna D Byron
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my Husband before Christmas and he loves it, I love that it was delivered on time and did not have to wait around all day.  The guys delivering it were great.

Reviews.Title: vizio e55OVL 55 inch Hd LCD TV
Reviews.Author: jhb
Reviews.Content: We have been extremely pleased with this TV.  It has an excellent picture.  We were very surprised and please with delivery which included 3 strong, nice guys who not only brought the TV earlier than expected but set it up COMPLETELY, so that when they left all we had to do was sit down and be amazed at the big, beautiful picture.  There was nothing about this transaction we were unhappy about. We even found the TV listed for less than we paid and the difference was immediately credited to us.

Reviews.Title: LOVE It!!!
Reviews.Author: M. Sanders
Reviews.Content: We love this TV!  I'm not sure why the other reviewers are having problems.  We are a TV family.  We have a TV in almost every room.  We have had Panasonic, Tosheba, Samsung, Phillips and RCA.  This is the best TV we have ever had.  Blu-Ray shines!!  PS3 Rocks!  HD is F-ing awsome!

Reviews.Title: GREAT VALUE FOR A QUALITY PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: CJM
Reviews.Content: Just received this TV last week.  It is an excellent product with an excellent price.  It showed up 2 days after I ordered it with no tax and no delivery charge.  On top of that, it was delivered by 2 friendly guys who brought it down into my basement and setup.  Not only did they do that, they also carried down a heavy TV stand that I purchased elsewhere.  The next best price I seen on this set was Sam's Club where I would have had to pay a little more, pay tax, pick it up and set it up my self.More on the television - I seen reviews on this set complaining about the quality.  In my opinion I don't know what their talking about; love the picture.  I'm sure if you spend $500-$1000 more you can get a better picture; but with the way technology changes so rapidly why would you want to do that?  Also you can spend more and get apps.  There again, with technology changing so rapidly I feel that would be a mistake also.  What I did is with the money I saved, I bought a blue ray player that has more options than any TV I seen on the market.  One downfall that I see is the connections in the back.  It's more than sufficient for my needs;  but if someone has a lot of components to hookup, I can see where it can be a problem.  However, I have a Blue Ray and Fios box hooked up with an HDMI cable, my stereo and my Wii connected and still have room for more.

Reviews.Title: 55 inch Visio HDTV
Reviews.Author: R. T. Adams "grzlyadams"
Reviews.Content: Great Television.  Good picture.  My wife thinks it's too big for the room but it really isn't!  She is just used to the little CRT TV it replaced.  It is a great purchase!

Reviews.Title: 55" Vizio
Reviews.Author: SC buyer 2011
Reviews.Content: The TV was a great value, $400  below Mfg. Suggested Retail price. Consumer Reports rated it a best buy and I agree.

Reviews.Title: love it!!!
Reviews.Author: carebear2011
Reviews.Content: Well, I'm not one to be spoiled, but I love this tv. It's so clear and it is capable of doing anything we need. I can watch tv/dvd/blu ray I can even use the internet with my tv!! It's a great thing. I rec. this tv for anyone. Shipping was fast, price was GREAT! can't say enough!

Reviews.Title: Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: Thomas L. Miller "tbirdtom"
Reviews.Content: This TV (55"LCD) is awesome.  Besides the picture being great the stereo sound system is fantastic.  Would recommend this to anyone for a top value.

Reviews.Title: nice!!
Reviews.Author: Connie S. Rider
Reviews.Content: We were really happy with it. Amazon had it brought in and set up for us. That was great. Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Good to go
Reviews.Author: Spaided
Reviews.Content: Great so far, just got it today, but much better than my JVC 1080i unit...I'll update this as the time goes one, but for now the only downside I see is, I love inputs....Could use some more!This TV has not let me down! Its screen quality is amazing.  Don't go off and spend 2000 dollars on a Sony brand (I actually like Sony but really expensive) when you can save a ton and get great quality.  I use it on 1080p most of the time and i never see any pixelation or color bleeding.  It's 120 Hz so no motion blur here either.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Barry F. Hollis
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV to replace our 42" Panasonic Plasma located in our living room, since we wanted a larger screen size.  We use it for HDTV and PS3 gaming and are very please with the performance.  Have not observed any issues with 120 Hz gaming performance and the HDTV picture is very crisp and clear.  Finally, we have not observed any issues with LCD picture while viewing from an angle.

Reviews.Title: Jeckyl and Hyde
Reviews.Author: Brandon Scott
Reviews.Content: This TV looks great when you view it head on, but the more steps to the right or left and the colors really get a white washed out.In the Summer of 2010 I became a really big fan of Vizio when I took a chance and purchased a Vizio E470VL which is the 47 inch version of the TV.  I loved that one so much that when I finally convinced my wife that buying a 55" TV for under $1000 was a requirement and not an option to watch the NFL playoffs I picked up this Vizio E550VL.My biggest and really only complaint about this TV is that the viewing angle is not very good.  If you look dead on, the TV is wonderful and vibrant.  Take a couple steps right or left and it gets white washed.  I know that LCD tvs will look worse the further right or left you get and no I am not looking at this thing directly from the side.  It almost makes it unwatchable especially if you are walking around in the room.  I've turned off smooth motion and all the other settings like I did for the 47 inch version of this guy.  No contrast, etc setting helps.  Had I spent more than $1000 for this TV and if inevitably in the future I would not be putting this TV in my bedroom years from now where looking at the TV from an angle would be minimized.  I do not see this same effect on the 47 inch version of this TV and in fact the colors really don't change on that one until you are almost looking at it from behind the TV.Minus this contrast issue when view from off center, the TV has a nice picture.  During fast motion sports like football, hockey, etc I see no pixelation like I've seen on other TVs.  I can stand about three feet away from it and the picture still looks good.  It obviously looks good from 10-15 feet which is where you would be sitting.Since I was so bothered by this white wash loss of colors I went to a big box store to see if this behavior occurs on all TVs or if it was just mine.  It turns out this happened on the display model at the big box store also.  Looking at other brand LCD that were 55" I noticed some also had this issue and some did not (do not recall the brands).  What was really shocking to me is that the big box store (wally world) had the 2010 E550VL and the 2009 E550VL (it has a big ugly transparent panel at the bottom of the TV) right next to each other.  The 2009 E550VL has worse specs at least on contrast ratio, but DID NOT have this white wash issue when looking from the sides.  If you choose to look at this TV in person before you buy which I recommend note that this white wash is less pronounced in retail stores becasue they position the overhead lights and you first notices the glare from them than the issue with the colors.So while I see that Amazon now has this TV for under $1000 now so is the E470VL ( 47 inch in the same model family) which I also have and is wonderful.  I frankly would recommend that even though is smaller or wait until the LED TVs come down in price.

Reviews.Title: Crisp picture, but lag makes it worthless for video games.
Reviews.Author: Kenny
Reviews.Content: I seriously can't even play Super Mario Bros 1 on this TV.  I'll hit the jump button, but by the time it finally decides to jump, I'm already dead. Tech support says there's nothing to do to fix it, so I'm returning this TV tomorrow.  If you don't plan on playing any games that require quick reaction time, then I guess this TV would be good.Edit: Here's how I know it's the TV:I had an NES hooked up via composite, the 360 and computer were hooked to different HDMI ports (the 360 was direct HDMI, the computer was DVI -> HDMI adapter).  All devices had input lag hooked to this TV, and didn't have input lag when hooked to my other TVs.Subjectively, the composite seemed to lag the worst. I ran an objective test on the computer. I hooked up a second monitor as a control, cloned them, and ran a timer display. I then took a photo with both monitors in focus to compare the times displayed. The results can be seen at [...] and show an undeniable lag. This is with all video processing settings turned off to get the lowest possible lag.

Reviews.Title: Great Value - Even better TV
Reviews.Author: zmc1985
Reviews.Content: Do your research, this tv is pure bang for your buck. If you are looking to stay nearer to 1000 and get something this size it is the best period. This is also my second Vizio and I love them both. The only limitation is hookups. 3 HDMI (one being the side) leaves some to be desired. It suits my tv needs but just barely in that regard.

Reviews.Title: No Contest
Reviews.Author: Barok214
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the delivery.  4/5: I ordered on a friday around 9pm and received it the next friday.  One day later than Amazon said but that's not the bad in my book.  Only reason this got a 4, is I had to call Ceva myself to schedule a delivery.  Trust me, do yourself a huge favor and call them when they get to your local hub it saves time and a headache.  I got a 12 to 4 slot.  So I stayed home expecting them to pull up at 3:30 or so.  Not so, they showed up at 12:05 and lugged it downstairs to my basement, (being careful the whole way.)  Got it out of the box and even helped hook up my dtv and put the batteries in the remote.  Overall very outstanding service.  Picture quality:  5/5  1080p never quite looked so good.  What can I say?  Rich vibrant colors, and razor sharp clarity.  The ambient lighting really adds to the experience as well.  I didn't think it'd be as nice as it was but it really accentuates the moods of the different scenes in a movie.  Lag time:  4/5  Don't get the wrong idea, this model doesn't lag during video games (at least for me.)  The only reason it's a 4, is that if you don't turn off smooth motion there is the tiniest (and I do mean tiny) not really lag.. but something was odd.  Not gamebreaking at all mind you so just remember to turn that off when playing games.  I believe it saves settings for the different inputs too, so do once and you're done.  Games play flawlessly now.  Connections:  4/5:  Eh I don't need 5 hdmi ports, but I can maybe see someone who does, but it does have a digital optical port which I love and use.  Not much to say.  3 hdmi, 1 composite, 1 component.. pretty basic.  Value for money:  5/5  Definitely worth at least $1600.  I got it for $1067.  Parents could not believe it.  They thought it was at least 2k.  If that says anything.Overall highly highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Iwazzabadboy
Reviews.Content: Saved sales tax and free delivery..979 bucks for a GREAT 55" LCD TV delivered to the door..No lags problems and sound is fine although I did hook it up to my Surround Sound system..No complaints..

Reviews.Title: 100% happy
Reviews.Author: bingo
Reviews.Content: I have had this set for a month now and still can't believe how good the picture is. I am constantly amazed at the detail and especially the brightness and contrast. The colors are so bright and true it almost looks 3D. And this is right out of the box, no adjustments or fine tuning.I don't know what these bozos complaining about the sound are talking about because the sound is clear and crisp. Even the neighbor commented how good it was.The DirecTV guy was so impressed, he ordered one for himself.I ordered it on Friday morning and it was here and running on Moday at 1pm. They even brought it in the house and unpacked it for me.Several days later Amazon had it for $38 less. I emailed them and they credited me for the difference right away.Top quality TV and top quality company in Amazon as usual. All this and no sales tax to boot, why would you go anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: ropak1
Reviews.Content: This shipped and arrived in a timely fashion. An excellent to exceptional value in every way. Great picture, easy to install, and the absolute lowest price I could find.

Reviews.Title: Great price for size and features
Reviews.Author: Robert D. Siegel "rocket rob"
Reviews.Content: At the time I purchased this TV, there weren't a lot of reviews, but I couldn't pass up the $950 price with no shipping or tax.  Amazon's delivery where I could schedule a time when my wife wasn't also home, was a big advantage too in making sure the TV was a big Christmas surprise.  It was delivered on time and had no issues connecting the TV.The TV picture and features are excellent in my opinion.  We were able to connect our Comcast Cable/DVR, DVD and Wii to it with no issues and enjoyed good picture and good sound on the TV.  The TV menu's were easy to navigate and we had no issues with lag playing the Wii that some other reviews talked about.  All in all, we are very happy with our purchase.  My only wish was that there was a way to auto-adjust the picture for non-HD sources.  Our Comcast box does not carry HD and some of the shows would be in different formats that require us to adjust the picture display from the TV remote from normal to zoom or to wide in order to fill the full screen.  But this isn't a huge deal, plus we purchased an audio/video receiver (Dennon's AVR-791) which now automatically upgrades any signal to 1080p so we no longer have this issue.

Reviews.Title: vizio 55
Reviews.Author: A. Qasim
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality. Timely delivery and installation. Call to Vizio customer service accorded good response. Overall very happy with Vizio and Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great value.
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: I was actually looking for an LED when I came across this tv, but I couldn't justify the price differential.When this tv came I was pretty ecstatic. The picture is incredible, it generates little to no heat, and the tv is remarkably thin/light [given its screen size].I really like it a lot.

Reviews.Title: Very good TV at a great price.
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: Ordered this TV from Amazon in early January. Great price and free delivery. TV was delivered eight days late after being lost in the delivery warehouse for a number of days. It was finally found on a Wednesday but not delivered until Friday. The TV comes in an easy open box and was extremely easy to set up. I followed the suggestion of other reviewers and turned off the Smooth Motion Effect. Had problems getting my DISH network remote to work until I turned off the Ambient Light Sensor. The picture is excellent and I think the sound quality is very good. I did some minor adjustments to the picture by lowering the brightness and color levels a little bit. I do get some glare from the windows near the TV, but it is not too bad. Overall, I am very happy with this TV and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Darrick A. Early
Reviews.Content: For the price it is a great large TV that provides an excellent picture.  If you are looking for a Sony, Samsung, etc with internet capability and 3D capability with mind blowing sound, then this is not your TV.  If you want a reasonably priced TV with a good picture then this is your TV.

Reviews.Title: a lot of TV for the price
Reviews.Author: R. Dolsen "louie_d_"
Reviews.Content: I've only owned this TV for a couple days now and am still tweaking the settings.  As others have noted the picture is a little too sharp, giving a video tape look to everything.  I'm hoping that can be fixed by adjusting some of the settings.  You'll want to turn off the ambient light detection if you use infrared remotes too.  There are fewer picture settings than on my Sharp HDTV, which is both a good and a bad thing.  My other TV had more adjustments than wanted or even knew what to do with.  On the other hand, my Sharp had the ability to manually set the refresh rate, including a 24fps "film" mode, which I miss.  I also don't like the big "VIZIO" splash screen everytime you turn it on either.  On the other hand, I do like the illuminated logo that is white when the tv is on and orange when it is off.  I haven't had a chance to judge the sound or the picture at full 1080p yet.Overall, I think it is a great value for the price.  There are definitely better TVs out there, but I think you'd be hard pressed to find a better 55" 1080p HDTV for under $900.

Reviews.Title: Go Vizio go.
Reviews.Author: Brian C. Marcos
Reviews.Content: I already owned a 42" Vizio via model for the bedroom and loved it so brand was a no brainer at the price offered on the 55" without non via internet app model.No regrets.Love it.

Reviews.Title: Good deal for a great TV
Reviews.Author: A. Oliver
Reviews.Content: First off, the delivery guy was willing to carry it upstairs with me, saving me some trouble.  The TV is about 100 pounds in its box.  (Just 70 unboxed without the stand)The TV is plenty bright, even with a room with lots of light.The sound is decent, not tinny or thin.Very good value overall.

Reviews.Title: 55" vizio LCD TV model E550VL
Reviews.Author: J. Daniel Whittenberger
Reviews.Content: We got this TV in a pre Xmas sale for a good price and free home delivery.  Given the size of this TV, we were quite surprised that it arrived in a few days.  The TV is working fine and I appreciate the energy savings.  Both my wife and I are quite satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Not worth money
Reviews.Author: Will
Reviews.Content: When I bought this television, I was really impressed.  Color and picture were great.  I have had it 1.5 years now and the main board has gone dead.  This is a common problem, just search vizio main board faulty or won't turn on.  I can't find the main board on the Internet to buy and replace myself.  The repair place in my town says$400 to fix.  I paid$1000 for it so $1400 to have it for more than 1.5 years is ridiculous.  The parts are cheaply made.  Spend the extra $100-200 and buy a better brand.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: Charles Prahl
Reviews.Content: A great TV when it works.Picture quality and power consumption are excellent. At the one year mark I started having input issues at the two year mark the board just up and died. A grand for two years service, really impressive!My first and last Visio ever...

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy this piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Mariah
Reviews.Content: Do not... I repeat, DO NOT buy this piece of junk TV. I bought mine new for over $1000. HDMI 1 port went out after only a few months. Vizio fixed it under warranty, but the repair was only covered for 30 or 90 days. The same port went out again just after the warranty. Vizio refused to fix it, even though it was the same issue, unless I paid over $500 because it was no longer under warranty. So I just used the other 2 HDMI ports. Then HDMI 2 went out about a month later. Now HDMI SIDE went out 3 weeks after that. So I can't watch my TV that is just over a year old. I called a TV repair guy who told me this is a common reoccurring issue that Vizio just send out new mainboards that will have the same problem. Vizio needs to correct the issue & recall it for PROPER REPAIR!!It is now just a big useless POS in my house taking up space. Worse TV I've ever owned. My Sanyo that is nice & bought the same day, no issues ever.

Reviews.Title: Trash
Reviews.Author: Uncle Ray
Reviews.Content: This TV is being marketed at a "discounted 55" TV" however it is a CHEAP TV. Mine is under 1.5 years old and I have had numerous issues with it. Been told by Vizio that the repairs Vizio has made during the warranty are not covered 5 minutes after the year warranty was up. When I explained that the "new" parts they had installed were only 6 months old it was explained that this was their "policy". NOT GOOD GUYS! Save yourself and make a purchase from a quality company not a CHEAP company.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 55" HD LCD Television
Reviews.Author: Conventioner
Reviews.Content: I have bought 4 of these units and the picture quality is "Rock Solid" and the navigation through all the screens and various menu items is very easy and completely user friendly. We use the Vizio 55" TV's for trade shows, meetings as well as having one at my home and the picture quality is the best i have seen anywhere. Strong love for the Vizio 55" LCD HDTV. I plan on purchasing 8 more for an even dozen! My only complaint was how Walmart shipped the last two that I purchased. The boxes were completely destroyed. Not the first thing you want to see when the truck pulls up but both models work perfectly. In my mind another testimony to the durability of the Vizio brand TV. Not even a horrible shipping experience can hurt the Vizio performance! I would recommend this TV to anyone and the price has dropped over $300.00 since last year, nice!

Reviews.Title: A total LEMON
Reviews.Author: Queen Mean
Reviews.Content: My husband bought this tv from Amazon.  The first one that was delivered had to be replaced due to a black spot.  So this is the second one.  14 months after purchasing it (and of course after the warranty has expired) the TV is dead.  You can get audio and sound but no picture.  Complete waste of money on a completely shoddy, cheaply manufactured piece of corpolite.  Buyer absolutely beware.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 55 TV
Reviews.Author: MinPin1N
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased with the purchase of our 55in Vizio. We looked a long time before we bought this tv and so glad we decided to go with the LCD HDTV.Great Price, Great Service

Reviews.Title: Simply Amazing
Reviews.Author: Islandson
Reviews.Content: I must be the luckiest person to have purchased this television. The unit I purchased was an open box unit with full warranty minus remote, manual or box from a local wholesaler. This wasnt a problem as a remote was acquired for $15 on amazon and the manuals can be downloaded. This TV is now sitting in my house after paying a hefty $550 for it. In addition to that, I purchased a 2 year extended and replacement warranty so I'd be fully covered. All together and out the door $631. :)TV is hooked up to a surround sound system therefore I could not review the Television's sound capabilities. (I don't use the internal speakers)The video however, I can certainly review. The quality of the video is incredible, absolutely remarkable. The picture looks like you are right there, it is amazing.It does take some tweaking however it can be set in under 10mins.Here is my preference for picture setup.Smooth motion Effect - HighReal Cinema Mode - PrecisionNoise Reduction - MediumColor Enhancement - Rich colorAdaptive Luma - MediumFilm Mode - AutoBacklight Control - DCR (Dynamic Contrast Ratio - Uses a bit more power but enhances the color)Ambient Light Sensor - OFF (Do yourself a favor and turn this off, the color is far more vibrant with it off)This Tv is well worth it. It doesnt have all the bells and whistles like Netflix etc, however if you have a ps3, xbox or stand alone Bluray player with those capabilities, then the argument is moot.Enjoy this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Value!
Reviews.Author: MG
Reviews.Content: All I can say is watching TV has never been enjoyable. After owning this for a year I noticed that the picture quality gets better and better-- the color is more rich and vivid. I also liked the fact that there are multiple connections so you can connect your camera, laptop or desktop, a dvd player and satellite all at the same time. It feels like you are in the movie house, only at the privacy of your own living room. If we were in the market for another TV, I definitely will go back looking for a Vizio brand.

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy
Reviews.Author: J. Wells
Reviews.Content: It is hard to go wrong with this television. My only complaint is that when entering channel numbers, I cannot simply enter a 7, for instance, for channel 7. I have to enter 7-1. My Samsung plasma automatically enters the -1.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the money
Reviews.Author: RyanThomasTrumpet
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy my new tv. It has a nice style to it and has a great picture. This tv is an amazing value for the money!

Reviews.Title: Better than the picture
Reviews.Author: Luxuria
Reviews.Content: As soon as people walk into my livingroom they commmnent on how great the tv looks.  Picture is awesome, sound is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: foyman "foyman"
Reviews.Content: This HDTV has the best picture I have seen, bar none.  The only knock I have is that it is not 100% compatible with my DTVPAL DVR controller (can't control sound).  Aside from having the inconvenience of needing two controllers and not being internet ready (which is not important to me) this is a set with excellent picture and sound.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 55 1080
Reviews.Author: Tom Redmond
Reviews.Content: You cant get a better picture on a TV. This is 10X better than my 46 inch Toshiba 1080 TV.

Reviews.Title: Frustrating lag and poor sound; very good picture
Reviews.Author: progstock "progstock"
Reviews.Content: No complaints about the picture -- for a low-priced big screen it's quite good. Problems I have center around the poor sound controls and horrible, horrible lag times with satellite tv and DVR.A workaround on the sound lag that seems to help quite a bit is to ensure the TV is put in GAME mode from the MENU --> PICTURE submenu. This picture mode gives you no contrast, brightness or color control, but it has an option called FAST RESPONSE that helps to keep the audio and video processing in sync. Outside of GAME mode, this television is useless.Sound controls feature a logarithmic gain that makes absolutely no sense. From 0-2 the sound goes from zero gain to too-loud-for-a-sleeping-partner. From 30-60 there is really little difference. I don't know who designed it, but they clearly didn't test their work in real life surroundings. Vizio's proprietary TRU VOLUME controls cause the sound to arbitrarily get louder and quieter, and is terrible when viewing sports. Again, product designers apparently didn't test before sending to market!In the final analysis, if you're on a tight budget this may be a good choice. The picture is very good, even  in GAME mode (required if you have satellite TV or plan on doing any gaming), and the sound, though weak, is acceptable and it's shortcoming can be circumvented by purchasing an inexpensive Dolby sound system.

Reviews.Title: Good TV... Crappy Trucking Company
Reviews.Author: ccc
Reviews.Content: Got from shipper to my city quick but one little snow storm and they insisted on pushing the home delivery out a week. After much fighting with them they delivered the next day (1 day late).

Reviews.Title: vizio e55ovl
Reviews.Author: vince
Reviews.Content: had my hdtv since1/04/11.. so far no problems..easy to setup.. hope to get to enjoy it for yrs. to come..tried hooking up my laptop  ok just have to get to transfer my audio from laptop to tv.. I.m working on it..

Reviews.Title: Low end Vizio.
Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: Returning this T.V. tomorrow as well. My biggest thing would have to be the contrast ratio. It's substantially low for a 55"  1080p at 120hz 100,000:1 several competitors are well above that contrast at only 100-400$ more.  It makes a vast difference in blacks and white colors. The picture is somewhat grainy when watching 1080 and high def television. Adjusted distance from TV and it did nothing, also have an xbox 360 and noted that there is indeed a response time lag of at least 10-14ms.

Reviews.Title: 55 in vizio
Reviews.Author: Shaquan
Reviews.Content: I love this size and price of this television. However, the remote control that came with it doesn't work for any of the functions other then the volume on the tv. The picture is so clear that everything looks like a documentary......which is not cool. Sometimes I see stactic across the top of the screen. I'm not very satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 55"
Reviews.Author: Mama Bair
Reviews.Content: We were excited to get this TV.  We weren't expected to seeing to much but the theTV is life like and it seems closer to the action.  My husband liked  it for the sport events especilly college basketball games.  The screen is clearer and you can make out the people playing. Also we watched the PBR bull riding and It was more than we thought it would be great to see the bulls up front and not so far away. We would recommed this to any one deciding they would like a new TV.

Reviews.Title: TV Low Price Guarantee, Free Shipping, and Free 30 Day TV Returns
Reviews.Author: RH
Reviews.Content: TV Low Price Guarantee, Free Shipping, and Free 30 Day TV Returns.Read the fine print. TV Low Price Guarantee can be used only once.30 Day TV return can be used within 30 days.Orderd E550VL and charged $1047.97 on my CC.Used low price Guarantee once and credit back $29.99.So I paid $1017.98 for Vizio E550VL.Current Vizio E550VL is $999.98[2011-0212].Price difference is $18.00.FYI, Amazon ask me to return $1017.98 paid VIZIO E550VL 55-inch Full HD 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV and order $999.98 Vizio in order to get $18.00 back.Anyway, Vizio E550VL is working perfectly without Yahoo Internet widgets. I can play all 1080P HD/DTS/AC3/Multi-Channels movie trailers and Anime trailers connecting Vizio through Fanatic Digital® Hdmi Cable 5 Meter (15 Ft) High Speed Category 2 V1.3c 1080i 1080p Gold Plated V1.3 Hdmi to Hdmi Cable with Ferrite Cores with a medium power PC without any problems. I also connect Vizio with Nintendo Wii HD component Cable and run 480P(maximum) with good result.BTW, after weeks of testing I found out good CPU power is much better than weak CPU with strong UVD1/2/3 GPU. The reason is very simple. Most media players do not support high end functions in GPU.So get a cheap twin/tri/quad+ cores CPU with build-in trash integrated Intel GPU PC. Next buy a dirt cheap ATI HD 4xxx/5xxx GPU card and download/install klite,vlc/mpc/kmplayer. Later on if you want to play games, you can always add more memory and swap in a better GPU card. As to 1080p tiny pc/1080p media player boxs/1080p android tablets..., they all have problems playing complex 1080p media and lock-in software/firmware. An all purpose PC is the only way to play all Internet media.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: Its a big screen at a low price.  No built in Internet extras that will be obsolete in a few years.  The picture quality is excellent. Setup was easy.  Everything was assembled in the box.  Just plug in your video source and go.  The sound quality is pretty good, but I didn't get it for the sound.  It has all of the connections I needed with the exception of S-video.  But every box I have with S-video also has some other connector that works.  I have had none of the delay problems that others have mentioned in other reviews.  Read the manual boneheads.  There are settings to turn off all of the special features that might cause the delays.  I thought about getting the 47" Vizio, but I'm glad I went for the extra size.  This screen fills your field of view from across the room.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, bad delievery
Reviews.Author: Robert R. Garcia
Reviews.Content: Let's first talk about the Vizio TV before we talk about the delivery, which Amazon made up for. The High Def TV: Excellent quality picture, good sound for a Hi Def TV. Some reviewers complained about the looks? What for? The black design of the TV looks great. The gamer types who complain about playing their games and speed rate; please don't put me to sleep with that talk. For gamers, go buy the latest hot rod, over price TV for that, we just want to watch our TV and DVDs. I love this TV.Now let's talk delivery they were two hours late and never called me that they were running late. Amazon didn't say they would install the TV. Some of you, in some cities, got a couple of delivery men who set the TV up for you too. Well that's great for you. In my area, which is the greater L.A./Orange County area, the delivery service was lacking. One guy came in that didn't speak English very well. I don't even know if he has a green card, as Spanish was his native tongue. My wife was home so I talked to this guy on the phone, from my work. He said he would at least put the TV on my TV stand. Later I came home and the TV was still on the floor. My wife said that he said his helper was out in the truck and could not come in because they have stolen the other TVs in the truck so he had to stay outside in the truck. Hello?  I told the Amazon lady from some other country. She said she would look into it. Later I e-mailed them. The response was that they would credit me 60 dollars (delivery cost - even though delivery was free) for any future purchase. I had to call my neighbor to help me pick the Vizio on to the TV stand.Well the system is working fine. Great TV. I'm sure other people have no complaints if they live in another city that speaks English.

Reviews.Title: Delivery made the item less desirable
Reviews.Author: Mimstress
Reviews.Content: Bought this item from Amazon after I found it here for $10 (plus no taxes) than at Wal-mart.  However, that's when the headaches started.  Not with the television but with the delivery process.  The website said I would be contacted by the delivery company Amazon chose.  In fact when my estimated delivery date arrived I checked to see if there was an update, and lo and behold it said I had been called by the delivery company (Home Direct) and a message left.  Yet when I checked my home phone and cell phone there were no messages and there was no contact information in the tracking portion of the order.  I had to contact Amazon and they called the delivery company, who in turn called me to arrange delivery.  At first I was told that the delivery company had until the following Monday to deliver, which was actually 5 days after the estimated delivery, and that it was impractical for them to deliver earlier than that because they didn't have any other deliverys in my area and they would be losing money to make a trip to my house before at least Saturday.  So, I finally gave in and accepted the Saturday date and an early time slot, but guess what.  My time slot came and went, so I called Home Direct and they forgot to put my order on the truck that morning.  However, they did put it on another truck and rush it out to my house within the next 30 minutes.  Don't see why they couldn't have done this in the first place.  Needless to say I am very disappointed with the delivery portion of my order, but the television looks great and was easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Had it for 30 days and doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Kayley
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased until the unit went dead.  No power to the television.  Vizio will replace supposedly with a new unit but I have found several reviews of Vizio units not functioning after a few years...past warranty and being told unit cannot be fixed buy something new.  Unacceptable. Hoping to return unit.

Reviews.Title: why 480 on hdtv
Reviews.Author: Larry A. Gray "oldhippie"
Reviews.Content: Just helped a friend hook up one of these T.V.'s. Have 1 question, hooked up asony Blu Ray player, thru HDMI cable, and put in the new Avatar, & the DarkKnight Blu Ray DVD's, and when you bring up menu it only shows it's running480?? On my sony XBR they show 1080. How come? anyone know.  Thanx

Reviews.Title: BUYERS BEWARE:  DO NO BUY A VIZIO!!!
Reviews.Author: Khoi Dang
Reviews.Content: BUYERS BEWARE:  DO NO BUY A VIZIO!!!  Vizio TV's are cheap, and they appear to give you the biggest bang for your buck, but they simply to no work as promised.  I purchased a Vizio XVT553SV which, at the time, was their flagship model.  Immediately, it had video artifacts/flickering on every input (Dish, PS3, media player).  Vizio's website even admits to this and promises that a firmware update and clean storage procedure would fix this!!! Vizio updated the firmware, and the issue appeared to be resolved for a few weeks, but then returned.  Vizio customer support had me do a power recycle, which resolved the issue for a few weeks, but, again the issues returned and new ones appeared - the video would freeze upon a cold start-up, the TV would turn off automatically in the middle of watching TV for no reason whatsoever. Vizio technical support had me do clean storage procedure which appeared to resolve the issue for a few days, but then the issues again returned.  Technical support  also admitted that the issue of the TV turning off intermittently will still be an issue until Vizio updates the firmware and they are looking into this issue now.  Through these issues, we could still watch TV - the issues were merely a nagging nuisance.  Finally fed up and fearful that the TV would fail once out of the warranty period, I called Vizio and they sent out a Technician to replace the logic board.  Within an hour after the technician left, the TV failed altogether.  Vizio now wants to replace my new TV that was defective upon arrival with a recertified TV which I objected to.  In order to get a new TV, they want me to pay an extra $300.00 plus tax!  I asked "Ashley" of Vizio customer support how she would feel paying good money for a "new" TV, but instead, getting a recertified TV.  She said she would be upset but this is their corporate policy.  So, buy a Vizio at your own risk - because it is very risky to do so.  Incredible that Vizio would put out a product knowing that it had existing defects and then screwing customers over!!.
